intro: Mammillaria glochidiata var. crinita, commonly known as the Wooly Mammillaria, is a compact cactus species native to Mexico. It features a dense covering of white, woolly hairs that give it its distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–15 centimeters, with a globular or cylindrical shape. Its stems are ribbed and covered in small, spiny tubercles. It produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking contrast to its fuzzy foliage.
